intro: Bonamia ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaran endemic, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to its arid environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Bonamia ankaranensis is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
